WorkItem.Description:
Eugene,
 
As I indicated I was working on a replacement inface so that I could easily swap out my old calculation engine and implement the Flee calc engine to see if it was faster. I have the initial skeloton code complete but before I go any further I would like you to have a look at it. The two really important parts are the events and the Custom Function support. 
 
 
thanks
 
brian

Comments.Message:
I've also attached the .zip file.

brian
Thanks for posting the project.  I will have a look at it over the weekend as I won't have an internet connection tomorrow.
Sorry I'm running behind schedule.  I will have a look at it tomorrow.

Eugene,

Is there a way to instruct flee to create the variables if they are not already defined in the ExpressionContext.Variables?  I noticed that Flee throws and exception if I try to parse (x + y) and y has not been defined.  Do all of the variables for and expression need to be defined before you can create and expression?
